all recipes.name: Turkey Chili
all recipes.description: A delicious dish for game nights, ready in an hour.
ingredients: 2 1/4 cups diced tomatoes and green chilies
3 1/2 cups black beans with olive oil, onion and garlic
instructions: Chop vegetables.
Sauté onion with olive oil in a pot until fragrant.
Add ground turkey and cook until color turns white while stirring.
Gradually add vegetables, tomato paste, seasonings, and water (as needed to achieve desired consistency).
Simmer for 30 minutes over low heat.

all recipes.name: Salmon Spring Rolls
all recipes.description: Vietnamese-style, low-calorie dish with a light taste.
instructions: Mix teriyaki sauce, soy sauce and ginger. Slice salmon into even strips or cubes then marinade in fridge for 30 minutes. Cook in a lightly greased skillet over high heat for 3 minutes per side.
Cook noodles according to package. Wash and slice vegetables.
Dip rice paper in warm water for 10 to 15 seconds, remove and lay each side on paper towels to blot dry.
Layer rice noodles, vegetables, and salmon on top of each rice paper. Fold and roll.
Put on a plate then serve with desired sauce.

all recipes.name: Fettuccine Alfredo with Veggies
all recipes.description: Creamy and savory dish with low cholesterol content.
ingredients: 3/4 tsp garlic and herb seasoning blend
1/4 cup roasted garlic parmesan alfredo sauce
instructions: Cook pasta according to package.
Heat oil in a pan. Add onion and pepper blend, and sprinkle with garlic and herb seasoning blend.
Add alfredo sauce and tomatoes. Simmer for a minute.
Add spinach and put lid on for 30 seconds. Stir.
Add cooked pasta and sprinkle with parmesan, then serve.

all recipes.name: Chicken Patties
all recipes.description: Tasty, cholesterol-free dish for lunch or dinner.
instructions: Chop vegetables and mince chicken using a food processor.
Mix all ingredients in a bowl.
Form slightly flat patties and place on a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Put in preheated oven and cook for 20 minutes at 370°F or until golden brown.

all recipes.name: Peanut Butter Cookies
all recipes.description: Yummy peanut butter cookies that are extremely low carb.
instructions: Mix all 3 ingredients together and roll into 20 balls.
Preheat oven to 350° F (175° C).  Bake for 9 to 10 minutes - bake to the size of half dollars.
Divide the number of cookies by the carbs in the peanut butter to get a count per cookie.
Note: you can use creamy or chunky peanut butter.

all recipes.name: Oatmeal Muffins
all recipes.description: Taste like regular muffins and are yummy.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C).
Spray muffin pan with non stick spray or line with cupcake liners.
Mix oatmeal, salt, baking powder, cinnamon.
Add remaining ingredients until it resembles slightly runny oatmeal.
Fill muffin cups 3/4 full.
Bake 15-20 minutes until golden brown.

all recipes.name: Flax Bread
all recipes.description: This easy microwaved 'bread' turns out perfect every time.
instructions: Ground 1 cup of flax seeds.
In bowl #1: add ground flax, baking soda and baking powder. Mix well.
In bowl #2: add eggs, water, oil, sweetener (lik Stevia or Splenda) and vanilla. Mix well.
Add walnuts to dry ingredients.
Grease a microwave casserole dish - 8" diameter.
Mix both dry and wet ingredients together. Pour into greased microwave casserole dish.
Microwave on high for 5 minutes.
Turn upside down on to a baking rack. Cool. Turn over and serve slices. (Great with cream cheese & berries).

all recipes.name: Crustless Spinach Pie
all recipes.description: A delicious low carb, low calorie alternative.
instructions: Use fresh spinach and wilt over low heat in pan.
Chop onion and mince garlic.
Combine all ingredients in medium bowl.
Spray pie dish with non-stick spray. Pour mixture into pan.
Bake at 350 °F (175 °C) for 45-50 minutes.
Serve with favorite garnish and enjoy!

all recipes.name: Banana Muffins
all recipes.description: A banana muffin recipe ideal for a breakfast on the go or a snack.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375 °F (190 °C). Lightly grease 5 muffin cups or line with muffin papers.
Mix flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, oatmeal and salt in a large bowl.
Beat bananas, sugar, egg, vanilla and melted butter in another bowl.
Stir banana mixture into flour mixture just until moistened.
Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups.
Bake in preheated oven until golden and tops spring back when lightly pressed, 18-20 minutes.
